journals.notes: We'd still need to update the lib reference in the main repo. Maybe we simply shouldn't merge Transifex pull request that often... once a week is enough. Afaik, the bot will merge the commit together.
Still, reference could be updated only before releases and people responsible for translating could update their local files directly from the submodule.

In the end we have the same amount of commits to the main rep because of submodule updates. I do understand the 'spam' argument but it's also nice to show progress in any part of ET: L development directly. Sub module commits aren't shown on the web page and submodule update commits itself usually don't describe what has been changed in the libs.

>Maybe we simply shouldn’t merge Transifex pull request that often

subject: Move translations to submodule
description: The idea is to just attach a submodule with translations into main code repository instead of pushing translation updates directly into main repo. IMHO, translation commits just "pollute" main repo and make it more difficult to browse the changes history.
